intro: Cochlioda beyrodtiana, commonly known as the golden bell. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and evergreen, providing a contrast to the vibrant floral display. Cochlioda beyrodtiana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
